title: Immunopathology, Act I
author: ayobami
description: Review your knowledge of the various components of the immune system

questions.question: Toll-like receptors are pattern recognition receptors for cell damage and necrotic products
Innate immunity has antigenic speficity, but not immunological memory
The classical complement pathway is not a part of the innate immune system
The humoral branch of adaptive immunity is protective mainly against extracellular microbes and toxins
Cellular immunity is mediated by B lymphocytes
Interdigitating Dendritic Cells are located all over the body tissues
Immature dendritic cells in the liver are called Langerhans cells
Immature dendritic cells in the skin are called Langerhans cells
The portions of α-chain of MHC-I molecules are coded for by the HLA-A, HLA-B, and HLA-DR genes
The portions of α-chain of MHC-I molecules are coded for by the HLA-A, HLA-B, and HLA-C genes
The portions of α-chain of MHC-II molecules are coded for by the HLA-DP, HLA-DQ, and HLA-DR genes
The portions of α-chain of MHC-II molecules are coded for by the HLA-DQ, HLA-DR, and HLA-DS genes
CD-4+ T cells are MHC-II restricted
CD-8+ T cells are MHC-II restricted
The MHC-II receptor is located on all cells in the body, while the MHC-I receptor is located on dendritic cells, macrophages, and B cells
